para.text: TIGHT on a MIXED MEDIA COLLAGE. Torn photographs and blotches of acrylic, splattered by Spaghetti-O’s. Total Chaos.
GEMMA, 17, scrutinizes it. SPITS one last Sphaghetti-O. Done.
You sold your first collage at age 12. Profiled in Art in America at 16...
..and now your work is on the cover of the biggest record of the year.
Gemma smacks gum, charming and self-possessed.
Is there a question in there?
Fair enough. How about this: where do you find your inspiration?
I don’t really think about it. I sit down at the canvas, and I just see what I need to do. And I do it.
I guess when I start searching for inspiration, I’ll know I lost it.
PAUSE on Gemma’s smug face. PULL BACK-- it’s on YouTube, being watched by...
GEMMA, 35, at her desk, burnt out, staring vacantly at the footage, wondering when she lost it.
We drift off her to see what she’s gained: a West Elm sofa. A fiddle-leaf fig. A Peloton. In the BG, a Zoom meeting starts.
A hot coffee on her sticky note-covered desk. And 3 old ones.
An unopened set of high-grade Japanese knives, next to a torn-open Amazon box.
An Instagrammable humidifier. The EMPTY light is on.
A banana hammock holds a rotting black banana.
We do have a few topline notes. I can chat through them now.
A framed photo of Gemma at age 17, gloating beside a ROCK BAND, holding a PLATINUM RECORD PLAQUE.
One sec. Just loading up the deck.
Her mouse CLICKS as we PUNCH CLOSER to the ALBUM ARTWORK on the plaque. It’s her striking, vibrant COLLAGE.
The Marketing Exec, 30s, looms in the corner of the screen.
I’m just wondering if we could swap out the font on Option A for something more
Gemma stares at the bouncy bubble letters on her screen.
And can we, like, brighten it up? Just brighter across the board? It has to read as ‘
Yeah... we can play with that.
CLOSE ON Gemma’s thousand-yard stare as the Exec prattles on.

Gemma stares at her self-view box on the Zoom call. She catches movement behind her. Is there someone else in her apartment? She turns around to look. It's nothing. Probably a glitch. The Exec continues to drone.
You know what, you should come in! We can ideate on it, and then you can iterate it. Into your next pass. The final pass. Just gotta confirm with the team.
A TO-DO LIST APP opens -- 27 tasks left for the day.
REMINDERS chime constantly -- people to follow up with, mundane chores to do, projects to complete, and so on.
Her stylus dances across her tablet. She flies through fonts.
THE FRIDGE SWINGS OPEN. She snags a premade organic meal kit.
She inhales the limp, calorie-conscious grain bowl. Refills her coffee. Knocks it back. Fires off emails.
She stretches, cueing a symphony of cracks and pops. Looks around in confusion.
Opens her TO-DO LIST -- 17 tasks left. Her shoulders slump.
Sunk in her sofa, Gemma doomscrolls. Glances at the Peloton. Considers it.
’. Orders a $19 salad. $28 with taxes & fees.
Gemma POPS OPEN the salad container. Her eyes narrow as she slowly lowers her head toward the table.
There, sitting on the otherwise-spotless surface...
A chewed-up ball of GUM. But before she can even consider it--
Her phone vibrates. She checks the Caller ID. Double-takes. Takes a deep breath, and eagerly answers.
LAWRENCE, 50s, answers, all slippery charm & positive vibes.
Lawrence, hi! I’m so... uh, it’s great to hear from you!

Yeah. Been a minute, huh? I know it’s late, so I’ll dive right in: the guys are dropping a new record. It’s a total return to form, really an homage to the spirit of their debut. I was chatting with them, and we thought it’d be a cool opportunity to work with you again.
Gemma’s eyes flit across the room, back to the photo of her clutching the record sleeve with the rock band.
It's off-kilter. Weird. Gemma straightens it.
Her pulse quickens, but she maintains her composure.
I would absolutely be up for it. And thank you so much for --
Incredible. Good stuff. Full disclosure, We do have one other artist pitching on it.
The excitement drains from Gemma’s face...
Yeah. He’s blowing up, and I guess he’s a big fan of the guys. The label likes him for it, obviously, but, ya know, he’s expensive.
Anyway! If you can get me something killer as soon as possible, I can get it in front of them.
OFF Gemma, thrilled and terrified in equal measure --
A pill bottle POPS OPEN. An ADDERALL tumbles into her palm.
She finds the ALBUM. Slides out the record. Plays it LOUD.
Back to her desk. She props up the sleeve. Cracks her knuckles.
The record spins in a locked groove at the end of the side.
Gemma’s fingers drum nervously. She stares at a blank screen.
She crosses to the turntable. Flips the record.
The pill bottle POPS OPEN. A bottle of wine and a mason jar THUD onto the desk.
The record spins in a locked groove.
Wine bottle now half-empty. Still staring at a blank screen.
She grabs the bottle, closes her eyes, chugs, and...
And EXPLODES OUT OF HER CHAIR & SCREAMS.
She BOLTS to the turntable, SMASHES IT with the bottle, RIPS IT OFF THE TABLE, HURLS IT ON THE FLOOR, and STOPS IT OUT.
Two decades of artist’s block erupting like a volcano.
She catches her breath. Whoa. Felt good to let it all out...
CUT WIDE: But what a fucking mess. She should clean this up.
She shimmies around her coffee table -- and SLIPS ON THE SPILLED WINE and PLUNGES TOWARDS THE GROUND...
BANGING HER HEAD on the coffee table.
Gemma’s eyes peel open, rolling aimlessly. She finds focus.
She sits up, grimacing as she tenderly touches her head.
She lurches to her feet. Staggers towards the hallway...
... until she notices a TRAIL OF BLOOD leading down it. RED DROPLETS speckling the hardwood.
She checks her head for blood. Nothing.
Gemma tip-toes around the blood... advancing down the hallway... following it to... her BEDROOM DOOR.
The “blood” leads to a CAN OF RED PAINT on the floor.
A FIGURE stands in the shadows, facing the back wall. A PAINTBRUSH clutched in hand.
Gemma stares in shock, and on instinct, FLICKS ON the LIGHT.
Light fills the room, revealing an incredible RED GEOMETRIC MURAL stretching across the wall. Gemma’s jaw drops.
Who are you? What the fuck are you doing in my apartment?
With the Figure’s back turned, Gemma can’t see their face...
their paint-splattered overalls hanging from a wispy youthful frame...
The Figure turns... and Gemma’s mind melts as she stares into the face of... TEEN GEMMA.
Gemma’s mind short-circuits. Without looking away, she reaches out and FLICKS OFF the light. Nope!
The room is cast into darkness. She waits.
FLICKS IT BACK ON. Teen Gemma is still standing there, unimpressed as only a teenager can be.
WIDE ON THE TABLEAU of these two staring at each other.
Gemma sits, holding a bag of frozen peas to her head, still in shock.
REVERSE to see Teen Gemma leaning against the opposite wall.
I gotta be honest. I thought you’d be farther along by now.
You hit your head pretty hard, huh?
It’s simple. I’m you, back before you became...
Uh, excuse me? What does that mean?
I’ve been watching you. For years. And I’ve got bad news. What’s holding you back isn’t something good work ethic can fix.
In fact, even thinking about things like "work ethic" might be part of the problem.
’. You used to be reckless. You used to not give
. But you went soft. Got comfortable. Took the money.
Teen Gemma picks up an Amazon Echo.
What the fuck is this, even?
It's actually really cool. It's how I... order toilet paper.
Teen Gemma tosses the Echo off.
em. You’re so safe, you’re like a fuckin’ art traffic cop. It’s why nobody gives a shit about your work. Because you make nobody feel anything. Even you.
Ouch. Gemma is so burned to her core, it overtakes the fear.
You know what? That was too much.
Teen Gemma sits on the coffee table, gets on her level, and picks up the wad of gum. She pops it in her mouth. Gross.
Hear me out. What if. You and me. Worked
Look, I can go bury myself in the back of your mind
. And you can go back to doing whatever it is you do.
I stay, and we can make some really cool shit.
Teen Gemma CLAPS her hands, launching back to her feet.
FUCK YEAH. That’s what I’m talking about!
You've turned into such a rule-follower
You’ve got your whole life going on here, and I don’t want to intrude. So I’ll hang out on the sidelines. Shadow you. And if I want to jump in, I’ll just raise my hand.
Teen Gemma raises her hand like she’s waiting to get called on in class.
Like this. Then you just... call on me. You tap out, I tap in.
She tentatively points towards her, trying it out.
INT. GEMMA’S LIVING ROOM - THE NEXT DAY
CLOSE ON Gemma’s eyes opening. She struggles upright on the sofa, touches her bruised forehead, and grimaces.
Squinting into the midday sun pouring through the windows.
She looks around at the mess from last night.
She looks down at her hands -- dried up RED PAINT on them.
Gemma enters, to see the RED GEOMETRIC MURAL in eye-popping detail, covering almost the entire wall of her bedroom.
Gemma stands perfectly still. Looks betraying nothing.
Gemma’s phone chimes with a Calendar reminder.

para.note:
MARKETING EXEC Yeah. I just want it to really POP. There's just so much content on the service.
the rom com version vs the thriller. line

para.text: Gemma pulls up in her boxy, practical Kia Soul.
We FOLLOW a buttoned-up INTERN as he hustles through a glass doorway and hands out water bottles to a table of hip execs.
These are the fonts we’re really excited about.
A TV with FONT OPTIONS. Gemma’s face is frozen in a forced smile. Her forehead bruise is carefully covered by her hair.
I totally get it. Helps to see it in person. Thanks for having me come into the office. For this.
We need something hard and masculine.
Weren't we going soft and feminine?
So we’re gonna need you to make
Oh. So like a whole new poster?
Another Exec, male, 40s, sits across from her, jumps in.

Consumers of action content on the platform gravitate toward greased-up, jacked male characters. And tons of sparks in the background. Red-orange sparks. Like there was just an explosion, and our big guy does not give
Maybe. I’d have to see it.
Ok. Well. I’ll put something togeth-
His phone CHIRPS. He checks it. Holds up a single finger.
Gemma sinks into herself until a
GEMMA’S POV: RACK FOCUS past Exec 2, to see TEEN GEMMA in the INTERN’S BUTTON-UP, behind the glass with a closed fist.
Oh my God, this is so gay.
We don't really say things like that any more.
The sound DROPS OUT. Gemma is frozen in disbelief. Utterly gut-punched.
Teen Gemma slowly raises her hand. And stands there.
Gemma’s eyes flit back to the Exec, who finishes his email and sets his phone aside... but it immediately RINGS.
Ah. You mind if I take this?
CLOSE ON Gemma, seething, eyes locked with her maniacally grinning younger self. She nods the slightest nod. Let’s
HOLD on GEMMA’S FACE as an INCREDIBLE TRANSFORMATION occurs. Energy surges through her. Gemma’s repressed anger contorts into Teen Gemma’s devious give-no-fucks resting face.
Gemma takes in the room. Looks at her hands. Malicious.
Do you know how many jerkoff meetings I’ve had with jerkoff middle managers who think they’re creative because they think sparks look cool and like the contrast between orange and blue?
Do you know how many necks I’ve airbrushed off of floating heads?

Do you know how many times I've had to create "options" for brainless execs who change their minds on a whim? Do you know how much free work I've had to churn out because you matcha-sipping morons can't make up your minds? Do you know why you can't make up your minds? Because you don't have them. Nothing but air between those ears.
Do I really need to sit here and beg you for the right to mock up some limp-dick thumbnail?
Her rant draws the attention of other execs, all mortified.
It’s one thing to waste my talent, it’s another to waste my time. So yeah. I mind.
Exec 2 stares back at her, shell-shocked.
The only way you’ll get cinders, sparks, or embers out of me is if I burn this office down and piss on the ashes.
Gemma reads the room. Dead quiet. She turns back to the MARKETING EXEC, who’s fuming.
Gemma cracks her neck and gets up out of her seat.
Gemma shuts her front door, heart racing, invigorated.
Teen Gemma arranges a row of CANVASES along the wall.
Oh, we killed it. Destroyed. Burned down the house.
Whoa. No shit? How’d it end?
I was perfect. You'll never hear from them again.
But I need that job to make rent.
I forgot, did we make a pact to debase ourselves in Photoshop, or did we make a pact to make some fucking art?
You’ve already burned a day. Lawrence is waiting.
Gemma shakes it off. This is what she wanted, at least she thinks.
Gemma picks up the bottle of Adderall.
What is this trash anyway? What happened to Ritalin? That was the good shit.
Gemma stares at the canvases, apprehensive.
I haven’t done collage in years.
Teen Gemma flashes a winning smile. Crosses to Gemma and places a paintbrush in her hand.
You take the wheel. I’ll navigate. Let’s just see where we end up.
Gemma lines out the rule of thirds with a charcoal pencil.
hovers over the Vitamix with a can of paint.
Hang on, that will ruin my Vitamix.
Gemma flips through old magazines. Finds a mattress ad. Uses an X-Acto knife to carve out a snoozing man.
Teen Gemma grabs a serrated bread knife to SAW OFF a branch of the fiddle leaf fig tree. She squirts acrylic all over it, and presses it on a canvas, leaving a STAMP of its VEINS.
Gemma looks on, in awe at how
Teen Gemma makes it look. She honestly looks like she’s just fucking around, not giving too it too much thought-- or maybe even
Gemma, energized, rummages through her closet, grabs a 2x4 wood block, and wraps it with rope twine. She coats it in paint and imprints it, leaving what looks like gashes.
Teen Gemma looks on, proud. Damn, girl.
FLASH! A burst of light dissipates as Gemma lowers her Phone. Teen Gemma huddles next to her, relishing the final results.
The ALBUM ARTWORK sits on an easel, away from camera.
Maybe we should wait until morning, give it one more --
curls her lip, clearly not quite happy with the work. She slumps onto a chair in teen angst.
Gemma doesn't even notice in her newfound confidence.
She hits SEND. Slumps into a chair, fighting heavy eyelids.
God, I want this. If we get this, it could change
-- back to doing real shit. Shit that, like, fucking matters...
Teen Gemma nods slowly. Mulling it over.
And if we don’t get it?
Gemma shakes her head and opens her mouth to respond -- but lets out a massive yawn instead.
What's wrong with you? What's that? You're not pussing out on me, are you?
Somewhere in our 20s, we stopped pulling all-nighters.
Teen Gemma turns away. Shifts her weight. Then turns back, face plastered with a casual smile.
I still need to finish my mural. And you should really get some sleep.
We used to know how to rally.
Teen Gemma raises her hand expectantly. Gemma shrugs.
PAN OVER to see Gemma smiling with a touch of menace.
She eyes Gemma's phone on the table. Snatches it, conspiratorially.
MUSIC UP as Gemma/Teen Gemma opens the closet. It all sucks.
CLOSE ON a drawer opening, revealing a set of scissors.
She grabs an old T-shirt and jeans and chops ‘em to bits.
Gemma sticks her head in the sink under the running water.
She squeezes a shitload of gel into her hand. Slicks her hair back into an edgy ‘wet hair look’. It’s oddly sort of badass.
CLOSE ON Gemma's hand tearing open the box of Japanese knives.
CLOSE ON Gemma’s hand grabbing her car keys off a wall hook.
She starts the engine. Grabs the wheel with both hands, with the stiffness of a kid who just got her learner’s permit.
She looks at the controls, baffled. Finds the clutch, and...
THROWS it into reverse and shodily PEELS out of her parking spot, smoke billowing out of the boxy little car.
Cranks the stereo, blasting mid-2000s pop with a maniac grin.
She bombs down an empty street, swerving in and out of her lane as she applies dark eyeshadow in the rearview mirror, cutting off the next car over.
She bombs through an intersection, running a red light.
Gemma emerges into a dimly-lit, sparsely-populated dive bar.
A sly, intimidating smile on her face.
She looks down at her phone. On screen is Roland Pike's Instagram Story, a filtered pic of his hand holding an IPA.
She scans the thin crowd... and her gaze settles on a MAN in his early 40s, wearing a BEANIE.
Beanie Man's hand is wrapped around the same IPA.
She casually drifts through the space and lands at the bar a few stools away from Beanie.
Gemma coolly turns to see Beanie smiling at her.
I’m not trying to -- “gal” is a term of endearment, it’s not -- I meant “lady” -- er, “woman”.
Listen, it's 2023. We're all trying our best.
Gemma nods thoughtfully. Looks to the Bartender.
Gemma and Beanie are cozied up in a booth, a few more drinks deep, flirting and giggling.
A shared laugh peters out. They make eye contact.
Gemma leans in for a kiss, too aggressively. It's all tongue, she doesn't know what she's doing. Beanie is taken aback, but still intrigued.
You wanna maybe... get out of here?
A beat. Gemma cracks a smile
Beanie staggers out of the bar, tilting on his feet. Gemma hot on his heels, moving like an apex predator.
You sure you’re good to drive?
I’m good to do a lot of things.
Beanie snickers at the innuendo, rounding into --
A long, empty alleyway. Shadows. Puddles. Rats.
As Beanie's back is turned, Gemma slides the Japanese knife from her jeans.
Ah shit, did you get towed? That’s the worst.
Beanie GASPS as a KNIFE IS THRUST INTO HIS SPINE!
He collapses, his legs rendered useless instantly.
His BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAMS echo down the alley.
Beanie dissolves into panicky tears as he claws at the asphalt, dragging himself forward.
He spins onto his back, doing a half crab-walk as he tries to put distance between himself and --
Gemma, who stalks patiently after him. A blood-slick knife in her hand.
Beanie CRIES OUT for help -- Gemma FLIPS THE KNIFE IN HER HAND -- Beanie buries his face behind his arms --
The BLADE plummets into his chest! BLOOD SPURTS as it’s ripped out.
We hear his blood-choked GURGLES as Gemma raises the knife for another blow --
Gemma rouses. Looks around. She’s in her bedroom.
She checks the time on her phone -- 3:56am.
Glances down at her outfit- cut up and doused in red stains.
Rolls her eyes. Climbs out of bed...
Her bare feet land in a STICKY POOL OF RED LIQUID.
She pads out the door, following the trail of red --
Hey, would it kill you to clean up a bit before you tap out? I love the initiative, but it’s just --
She follows the trail into the kitchen... where it terminates in the butchered body of BEANIE lying face-down on the tile.
Torso riddled with puncture wounds. Ghost-white face drained of blood. Beanie somehow still in place.
And in one excruciatingly long moment of revelation, she realizes that she’s actually covered in blood.
Her mouth wrenches open -- she takes a deep breath --
A HAND CLAMPS OVER HER MOUTH.
Teen Gemma emerges from behind her, as if appearing from thin air, and slowly pulls her hand away from Gemma’s mouth.
Gemma ogles the body. Speaks in a hushed whisper.
Why the fuck would you do this?
Teen Gemma grins cheekily. Kicks him over onto his back.
Gemma sees Beanie’s face... it registers...
Holy shit! Do you know who that is?
Why the fuck would you do this?!
But we don't need to do this! Our stuff is good enough!
I saw what I needed to do. And I did it.
Don't you remember in fourth grade when we stole Lauren C.'s collage and tore it up? Whatever it takes.
But you're so good. You're so confident.
You're talking to the girl who wrote "I suck" for ten straight pages in our journal.
This is wrong. This is murder. This isn't who we are.
Did you forget all the ants we burned under the magnifying glass? The squirrels we caught and cut up?
(Maybe an insert of the Spaghetti-O art from the beginning here, the textures now taking on a more ominous look.)
Gemma's stomach sinks. She remembers the cat. She shakes her head.
No, that's not me. It doesn't define me. I worked through all that in therapy.
No. No. I'm past all this. I'm not crazy.
Teen Gemma flips on the InSinkErator. The motor FIRES UP.
ROLAND (fka Beanie) MOANS on the ground.
Gemma and Teen Gemma SCREAM and jolt back in unison.
Oh my God. Oh my God. We have to get him to the hospital!
Listen to me very carefully. I know this is a lot. I should’ve run this by you first. My bad.
Gemma notices the KNIFE clutched in Teen Gemma’s hand.
But I did this for us. If he gets out of here, we’re finished. Forever. We will never come back from this.
Gemma’s eyes well with tears. Teen Gemma isn’t wrong.
She drops her head. The decision is made.
Teen Gemma advances on Roland, knife arching back...
But Gemma grabs THE 2X4 WRAPPED IN ROPE...
Teen Gemma SLAMS INTO THE FRIDGE.
She dusts herself off and spins around, her face stamped with paint lines. She grabs the wine-stained MASON JAR and --
SMASHES Gemma in the jaw! Teeth CRACK as blood SPRAYS from her mouth.
She crumples onto the kitchen counter -- her hand juts out and grabs the X-ACTO KNIFE -- she whips around --
STABS Teen Gemma IN THE FACE! Teen Gemma reels, hissing through her sliced-open cheek, blood gushing out --
Bitch! After everything I’ve done for you!
Get over yourself! We’re not KILLING HIM!
FLASH TO ROLAND’S POV: There is just one Gemma, and she’s slogging through a knock-down drag-out brawl with herself.
Blocking her own kicks. Punching her own stomach. Pulling her own hair. Bending back her own fingers. Fighting dirty.
Roland gawks in disbelief, almost more confused than he is scared. Almost.
The women slam into the wall, and Gemma’s PHONE is knocked loose, sliding across the floor...
Landing just feet away from Roland.
Hope blooms in his eyes as he reaches for it. His fingers are just a foot or two away, so he starts slowly... painfully... tortuously pulling himself towards it.
They’re bloody and battered, each heaving for breath.
You didn’t have to do this. We had this in the bag.
I do. You and me, we
Gemma bleeds out. Teen Gemma listens.
I know it because I’ve looked back for so long, wondering whether or not I ever really had it, or if I was just good for my age.
Teen Gemma fumes. Insulted to her core.
I guess you’re not so sure either.
Teen Gemma gets right up in her face.
I don’t have a single fucking doubt.
With one last steadying breath, Gemma says...
Then why’d you take out the competition?
CUT TO Roland’s mangled body. Teen Gemma is
Teen Gemma bends down. Rises back up with the KNIFE once again clutched in her hands.
But now she’s looking at Gemma, not Roland.
Teen Gemma rushes Gemma -- Gemma grabs both of her arms -- struggling to hold her off.
Gemma twists the knife towards Teen Gemma... Teen Gemma twists it back towards her...
PUSHING PAST the fight as we hear the knife land with a wet splat. Then a grunt of pain. And a body hitting the floor.
LANDING on Roland, still reaching for the phone. His fingers just graze it... he gets a grip...
. A bare foot lands on the phone and slides it away.
ROLAND’S POV as he looks up at his tormentor...
GEMMA leers over him, silhouetted by the ceiling lights. Knife in hand.
She doesn’t look like a person. She looks like the void where a person used to be.
LIGHT FLARES off the blade as it shoots downwards.
CLOSE ON Gemma’s phone as a stream of blood shoots across it.
It CHIMES with a NEW MESSAGE from LAWRENCE:
Gemma, this is incredible! I knew you still had it! Already sent to the lads, back to you ASAP!
CUT WIDE to reveal the whole bloody massacre. Roland lies dead on the floor. Gemma rinses off her knife.
She walks over, dipping her hand on Roland's bloody chest.
PULL BACK to reveal the album artwork on the easel
. She adds the final touch - a smear of Roland's blood
. The snoozing man on the floor, as a woman rinses off dishes.
